lbfgsb

Class Minimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lbfgsb.Minimizer

  • public class Minimizer
extends java.lang.Object
    High-level wrapper for the L-BFGS-B algorithm
    Author:
    Mateusz Kobos

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int defaultCorrectionsNo 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Minimizer()
      Create algorithm with default values for all of the optional features.

    • Method Detail

      • getCorrectionsNo

        public int getCorrectionsNo()

      • setCorrectionsNo

        public void setCorrectionsNo(int value)
        Set number of corrections used in the limited memory matrix. According to the original fortran documentation, [3, 20] range is recommended.

      • getStopConditions

        public StopConditions getStopConditions()

      • getBounds

        public java.util.List<Bound> getBounds()

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(java.util.List<Bound> bounds)
        Set bounds for all of the variables.
        Parameters:
        bounds - consecutive elements of the list correspond to consecutive variables

      • setNoBounds

        public void setNoBounds(int variablesNo)
        A convenience method that makes all of the variables unbounded

      • setIterationFinishedListener

        public void setIterationFinishedListener(IterationFinishedListener listener)
        Set the listener which will be called after each iteration

      • getDebugLevel

        public int getDebugLevel()

      • setDebugLevel

        public void setDebugLevel(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - see the description of the debug level in the original fortran documentation for iprint argument

      • run

        public Result run(DifferentiableFunction fun,
         double[] startingPoint)
           throws LBFGSBException
        Starts the algorithm
        Parameters:
        fun - function we want to minimize
        startingPoint - starting point of the algorithm
        Throws:
        LBFGSBException - thrown if the input parameters were erroneous
